column4: Also, I mentioned this before, I had sound working, but after a reboot (possibly a few package installs) I lost it. Would anyone be able to help walk me through a fix
oops. did that before i asked you. had no noticeable effect, but it did complain that
it did complain that /etc/modprobe.d/ndiswrapper will require a .conf in the future (or something very similar)
try sudo alsa unload then sudo alsa reload
this is the result http://paste.ubuntu.com/212411/ it didnt seem to fx it
its trying to use pulseaudio..do you know how to change it to alsa?
ask some of the others as i look threw my notes on what could be problem.
go into systems settings under multimedia and see if you can change it there..
sorry, really slow here, is that in the menu? under settings somewhere?
i see something called pulseaudio preferences, but it doesnt give me that option
what packages where you installing when you lost sound?
see my private message for you
